care_en: Kerry Blue Terriers need regular daily exercise — about 1 hour of walks, play, and mental stimulation — and they excel in a wide range of activities including herding, agility, obedience, earthdog trials, and swimming (they are natural water dogs). Their soft, dense coat requires regular professional grooming every 4–6 weeks, including clipping and scissoring in the breed-specific pattern, plus brushing and combing at least two to three times per week to prevent matting. Their coat does not shed, which makes them suitable for allergy sufferers but means dead hair must be removed through grooming. Training should be positive, firm, and consistent — Kerry Blues are intelligent and capable learners but can be strong-willed and may test boundaries. Early, extensive socialization with other dogs is critical, as Kerry Blues have historically been known for dog aggression — many breed standards note that a certain 'gameness' toward other dogs is acceptable. They are generally excellent with children and loyal family dogs. They make outstanding watchdogs with a deep bark.
care_el: Τα Κέρι Μπλου Τεριέ χρειάζονται τακτική καθημερινή άσκηση — περίπου 1 ώρα βόλτων και παιχνιδιού. Το μαλακό τρίχωμα απαιτεί επαγγελματική περιποίηση κάθε 4–6 εβδομάδες συν βούρτσισμα 2–3 φορές την εβδομάδα. Δεν ρίχνουν τρίχα — κατάλληλα για αλλεργικούς. Η εκπαίδευση πρέπει να είναι θετική και σταθερή. Η πρώιμη κοινωνικοποίηση με σκυλιά είναι κρίσιμη λόγω τάσης για επιθετικότητα. Είναι εξαιρετικά με παιδιά. Κάνουν εξαιρετικούς φύλακες.
health_en: Kerry Blue Terriers have a typical lifespan of 12–15 years. Progressive neuronal abiotrophy (PNA) or cerebellar abiotrophy is the most significant breed-specific neurological condition — it causes progressive loss of coordination starting at a few months of age; a DNA test is available and breeding dogs should be tested. Hip dysplasia can occur and OFA screening is recommended. Eye conditions including cataracts, dry eye (keratoconjunctivitis sicca), and entropion should be screened for. Skin conditions are relatively common, including cysts (sebaceous and epidermoid), which are usually benign but may need removal, and follicular dysplasia. Hypothyroidism can develop with age. Ear infections may occur due to the hair that grows inside the ear canal — regular ear cleaning and hair removal is important. Blood autoimmune disorders including factor XI deficiency (a bleeding disorder) have been documented. Cancer, particularly melanoma, has been reported. Responsible breeders test for PNA, hips, eyes, and thyroid.
health_el: Τα Κέρι Μπλου Τεριέ έχουν τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 12–15 χρόνια. Η προοδευτική νευρωνική αβιοτροφία (PNA) είναι η σημαντικότερη νευρολογική πάθηση — υπάρχει τεστ DNA. Η δυσπλασία ισχίου μπορεί να εμφανιστεί. Οφθαλμικές παθήσεις πρέπει να ελέγχονται. Δερματικές παθήσεις και κύστεις είναι σχετικά κοινές. Ο υποθυρεοειδισμός μπορεί να αναπτυχθεί. Ωτίτιδες μπορεί να εμφανιστούν — τακτικός καθαρισμός αυτιών είναι σημαντικός. Αιμολογικές αυτοάνοσες διαταραχές έχουν τεκμηριωθεί. Οι υπεύθυνοι εκτροφείς ελέγχουν PNA, ισχία, μάτια και θυρεοειδή.

description_en: The Lakeland Terrier originated in the rugged Lake District of northern England — one of the most beautiful and mountainous regions in Britain — where they were developed by local farmers to protect their sheep flocks from the foxes that preyed on lambs during the critical spring lambing season. Unlike most terrier breeds that were developed for sport, Lakelands had a serious working purpose: they had to follow foxes deep into the rocky, narrow fell burrows and be tough enough to dispatch them underground. This demanded a dog that was small enough (7–8 kg) to squeeze through tight passages, yet courageous and tenacious enough to face a cornered fox in total darkness. Lakelands are compact, square-bodied dogs with a dense, wiry double coat and a characteristic neat, rectangular head with a keen, confident expression. They come in a variety of colors including black and tan, blue and tan, red, red grizzle, grizzle and tan, and wheaten. They are friendly, bold, and confident dogs with a jaunty, self-assured demeanor — more good-natured and less aggressive than some terrier breeds. In 1967, a Lakeland Terrier named Donn achieved the rare double of winning both Best in Show at Westminster and Crufts in the same year.
description_el: Το Λέικλαντ Τεριέ κατάγεται από τη σκληρή περιοχή Lake District της βόρειας Αγγλίας, όπου αναπτύχθηκε για να προστατεύει πρόβατα από αλεπούδες. Σε αντίθεση με τα περισσότερα τεριέ, είχε σοβαρό εργατικό σκοπό: να ακολουθεί αλεπούδες σε στενά βραχώδη λαγούμια. Είναι συμπαγή σκυλιά (7–8 κιλά) με πυκνό σκληρό τρίχωμα. Είναι φιλικά, τολμηρά και σίγουρα — πιο καλόβολα από πολλά τεριέ. Το 1967, ένα Λέικλαντ Τεριέ πέτυχε το σπάνιο διπλό Best in Show σε Westminster και Crufts την ίδια χρονιά.
care_en: Lakeland Terriers need regular daily exercise — about 45–60 minutes of walks, play, and mental stimulation — and they enjoy agility, earthdog trials, and interactive games. Their dense, wiry double coat requires professional hand-stripping every 8–12 weeks for proper coat maintenance (clipping is acceptable for pets but softens the coat), plus weekly brushing at home. They are intelligent and can be trained to a high level, but retain terrier independence — positive, consistent training with varied exercises prevents boredom. Early socialization with people, dogs, and various environments is important to develop their naturally confident, friendly temperament. They have a strong prey drive and will chase small animals, so secure fencing is essential. They can be assertive with other dogs, particularly those of the same sex. They are relatively adaptable to apartment living given their moderate size and energy needs, provided they receive sufficient daily exercise. They can be vocal and make alert watchdogs. They are generally affectionate and playful with children.
care_el: Τα Λέικλαντ Τεριέ χρειάζονται τακτική καθημερινή άσκηση — 45–60 λεπτά βόλτων και παιχνιδιού. Το σκληρό τρίχωμα απαιτεί hand-stripping κάθε 8–12 εβδομάδες συν εβδομαδιαίο βούρτσισμα. Η εκπαίδευση πρέπει να είναι θετική με ποικιλία. Η πρώιμη κοινωνικοποίηση είναι σημαντική. Έχουν ισχυρό ένστικτο θήρας. Μπορεί να είναι επιθετικά με σκυλιά ίδιου φύλου. Προσαρμόζονται σε διαμέρισμα. Κάνουν καλούς φύλακες. Είναι στοργικά με παιδιά.
health_en: Lakeland Terriers are generally a healthy, hardy breed with a typical lifespan of 12–15 years. Legg-Calve-Perthes disease (aseptic necrosis of the femoral head) is the most commonly cited orthopedic condition — it typically presents in young dogs with progressive lameness and can require surgical intervention. Primary lens luxation (PLL) is an eye condition that can lead to glaucoma; a DNA test is available. Cataracts have been documented and regular eye screening is recommended. Patellar luxation can occur in some individuals. Von Willebrand's disease (a bleeding disorder) has been reported in the breed. Hypothyroidism may develop. Skin allergies and conditions can occur, though proper coat maintenance helps prevent issues. Dental disease should be monitored, as it affects many small breeds. The breed is considered one of the healthier terrier breeds overall with relatively few serious genetic conditions. Responsible breeders test for PLL, eyes, patellae, and Legg-Calve-Perthes.
health_el: Τα Λέικλαντ Τεριέ είναι γενικά υγιής ράτσα με τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 12–15 χρόνια. Η νόσος Legg-Calve-Perthes είναι η πιο κοινή ορθοπεδική πάθηση — εμφανίζεται σε νεαρά σκυλιά. Η PLL μπορεί να οδηγήσει σε γλαύκωμα — υπάρχει τεστ DNA. Ο καταρράκτης έχει τεκμηριωθεί. Η εξάρθρωση επιγονατίδας μπορεί να εμφανιστεί. Η νόσος von Willebrand έχει αναφερθεί. Ο υποθυρεοειδισμός μπορεί να αναπτυχθεί. Θεωρείται μία από τις πιο υγιείς ράτσες τεριέ. Οι υπεύθυνοι εκτροφείς ελέγχουν PLL, μάτια, επιγονατίδα και Legg-Calve-Perthes.

description_en: The Manchester Terrier is one of the oldest identifiable terrier breeds, developed in the industrial city of Manchester, England, during the 19th century by crossing the old Black and Tan Terrier (a renowned ratting dog) with the Whippet to create a sleek, fast, and devastatingly efficient rat killer. During the Victorian era, rat-baiting was a popular sport in Manchester's public houses, and Manchester Terriers excelled — one legendary dog named Billy reportedly killed 100 rats in just 6 minutes and 13 seconds. They are elegant, compact dogs weighing 5.5–10 kg with a distinctive, glossy jet-black coat with rich mahogany tan markings in a precise pattern — they are the quintessential black-and-tan dog and likely contributed to the development of several other breeds including the Doberman Pinscher. Manchester Terriers are alert, devoted, and spirited with a keen intelligence and a dignified, discerning temperament. They bond deeply with their chosen people but are naturally reserved with strangers, making them excellent watchdogs. The breed comes in two varieties: Standard (over 5.5 kg) and Toy (under 5.5 kg), with the Toy variety being particularly popular in the United States.
description_el: Το Μάντσεστερ Τεριέ είναι μία από τις παλαιότερες αναγνωρίσιμες ράτσες τεριέ, αναπτυγμένη στο Μάντσεστερ διασταυρώνοντας το Black and Tan Terrier με το Whippet για ένα κομψό, γρήγορο κυνηγό αρουραίων. Στη Βικτωριανή εποχή, ένα θρυλικό σκυλί σκότωσε 100 αρουραίους σε 6 λεπτά. Είναι κομψά σκυλιά 5,5–10 κιλών με γυαλιστερό μαύρο-καφέ τρίχωμα — πιθανότατα συνέβαλαν στην ανάπτυξη του Ντόμπερμαν. Τα Μάντσεστερ είναι επαγρύπνα, αφοσιωμένα με αξιοπρεπή ιδιοσυγκρασία. Δένονται βαθιά με τους ανθρώπους τους αλλά είναι επιφυλακτικά με ξένους, εξαιρετικοί φύλακες. Η ράτσα έρχεται σε Standard και Toy.
care_en: Manchester Terriers need regular daily exercise — about 45–60 minutes of walks, runs, and play — and they excel in agility, obedience, rally, lure coursing, and barn hunt. Their short, smooth, glossy coat is extremely easy to maintain with weekly brushing using a soft brush or grooming mitt and occasional bathing. They are highly intelligent and eager to please, making them one of the most trainable terrier breeds — positive reinforcement training produces excellent results. However, they can be sensitive and should not be trained with harsh methods. Early socialization is important, particularly with people, as they tend to be naturally reserved with strangers. They have a strong prey drive and will chase small animals, so leash control and secure fencing are important. They are heat-loving dogs that seek out warm spots and may need a coat in cold weather due to their thin, short fur. They are well-suited to apartment living given their moderate size and energy, and they tend to be clean and quiet indoors. They may be prone to separation anxiety if left alone frequently.
care_el: Τα Μάντσεστερ Τεριέ χρειάζονται τακτική καθημερινή άσκηση — 45–60 λεπτά βόλτων, τρεξίματος και παιχνιδιού. Το κοντό, γυαλιστερό τρίχωμα είναι πολύ εύκολο στη συντήρηση. Είναι ευφυή και πρόθυμα — πιο εκπαιδεύσιμα από πολλά τεριέ. Ευαίσθητα στη σκληρή εκπαίδευση. Η πρώιμη κοινωνικοποίηση είναι σημαντική. Έχουν ισχυρό ένστικτο θήρας. Αναζητούν ζέστη — μπορεί να χρειαστούν παλτό στο κρύο. Κατάλληλα για διαμέρισμα. Μπορεί να αναπτύξουν άγχος αποχωρισμού.
health_en: Manchester Terriers are generally a healthy, long-lived breed with a typical lifespan of 15–17 years, making them one of the longest-lived terrier breeds. Von Willebrand's disease (vWD), a hereditary bleeding disorder, is the most commonly cited health concern — a DNA test is available and all breeding dogs should be tested. Patellar luxation (slipping kneecaps) can occur. Legg-Calve-Perthes disease (degeneration of the hip joint) has been documented in younger dogs. Progressive retinal atrophy (PRA) and other eye conditions including cataracts and glaucoma should be screened for. Hypothyroidism may develop. Cardiomyopathy has been reported in some lines. Xanthine urolithiasis (a type of urinary stone) can occur in the breed. Pattern baldness (gradual hair loss on certain areas) has been noted. Heat bumps (urticaria) may occur in warm weather. Dental disease should be monitored, particularly in the Toy variety. Responsible breeders test for vWD, eyes, patellae, cardiac function, and thyroid.
health_el: Τα Μάντσεστερ Τεριέ είναι γενικά υγιή, μακρόβια ράτσα με τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 15–17 χρόνια. Η νόσος von Willebrand είναι η πιο κοινή ανησυχία — υπάρχει τεστ DNA. Η εξάρθρωση επιγονατίδας μπορεί να εμφανιστεί. Η νόσος Legg-Calve-Perthes έχει τεκμηριωθεί. PRA και άλλες οφθαλμικές παθήσεις πρέπει να ελέγχονται. Ο υποθυρεοειδισμός μπορεί να αναπτυχθεί. Καρδιομυοπάθεια έχει αναφερθεί. Ουρολιθίαση ξανθίνης μπορεί να εμφανιστεί. Η οδοντική νόσος πρέπει να παρακολουθείται. Οι υπεύθυνοι εκτροφείς ελέγχουν vWD, μάτια, επιγονατίδα, καρδιά και θυρεοειδή.

description_en: The Norfolk Terrier is one of the smallest working terrier breeds, standing just 25 cm tall and weighing 5–5.5 kg, yet packed with the courage and determination of a dog many times its size. The Norfolk and Norwich Terriers were originally considered the same breed — both developed in East Anglia, England, in the late 19th and early 20th centuries from various small ratting and den-working terriers. They were officially separated into two distinct breeds in 1964 (UK) and 1979 (US), with the sole distinguishing physical feature being ear carriage: the Norfolk has neat, folded drop ears while the Norwich has erect, pointed ears. Norfolk Terriers were popular 'ratters' at Cambridge University, where students kept them in their rooms to control vermin — they were known as 'Cantab Terriers' or 'Trumpington Terriers.' They have a hard, wiry, weatherproof coat in shades of red, wheaten, black and tan, or grizzle. Norfolks are among the most sociable and good-natured of all terrier breeds — they are alert, fearless, and spirited like all terriers but combine these traits with an unusually affectionate, companionable nature that makes them excellent family dogs and apartment companions.
description_el: Το Νόρφολκ Τεριέ είναι μία από τις μικρότερες εργατικές ράτσες τεριέ (25 εκ., 5–5,5 κιλά) αλλά γεμάτο θάρρος. Αρχικά θεωρούνταν η ίδια ράτσα με το Norwich — διαχωρίστηκαν το 1964, με μοναδική διαφορά τα πεσμένα αυτιά. Ήταν δημοφιλή «κυνηγοί αρουραίων» στο Πανεπιστήμιο Cambridge. Έχουν σκληρό, αδιάβροχο τρίχωμα σε κόκκινο, σιτάρι ή grizzle. Τα Νόρφολκ είναι ανάμεσα στα πιο κοινωνικά τεριέ — επαγρύπνα και ατρόμητα αλλά με ασυνήθιστα στοργική φύση που τα καθιστά εξαιρετικά οικογενειακά σκυλιά.
care_en: Norfolk Terriers need moderate daily exercise — about 30–45 minutes of walks, play, and exploration — and they particularly enjoy earthdog trials, agility, and interactive games. Their hard, wiry double coat requires weekly brushing and hand-stripping two to three times per year to maintain proper texture (clipping softens the coat over time). They are intelligent, eager to please, and among the more trainable terrier breeds — positive training methods produce excellent results. Early socialization with people, dogs, and various environments helps develop their naturally friendly, confident temperament. They have a prey drive and will chase small animals, but they generally get along much better with other dogs and cats than many terrier breeds. They are excellent apartment dogs due to their small size, moderate energy, and adaptable nature. They should not be left alone for extended periods as they are social dogs that thrive on companionship. They can be barkers if not trained early.
care_el: Τα Νόρφολκ Τεριέ χρειάζονται μέτρια καθημερινή άσκηση — 30–45 λεπτά βόλτων και παιχνιδιού. Το σκληρό τρίχωμα απαιτεί εβδομαδιαίο βούρτσισμα και hand-stripping 2–3 φορές τον χρόνο. Είναι πρόθυμα και εκπαιδεύσιμα. Η πρώιμη κοινωνικοποίηση βοηθά. Τα πάνε γενικά καλύτερα με σκυλιά και γάτες από πολλά τεριέ. Εξαιρετικά σκυλιά διαμερίσματος. Δεν πρέπει να μένουν μόνα πολύ ώρα. Μπορεί να γαβγίζουν.
health_en: Norfolk Terriers are generally a healthy breed with a typical lifespan of 12–16 years, often reaching their mid-teens. Mitral valve disease (MVD) is the most significant health concern in the breed — it is a progressive heart condition where the mitral valve deteriorates, leading to heart murmurs and potentially heart failure; regular cardiac screening is strongly recommended. Patellar luxation (slipping kneecaps) is a common orthopedic concern in the breed. Hip dysplasia can occur. Cataracts and other eye conditions have been documented; annual eye examinations are advisable. Dental disease is a concern in small breeds — regular dental care is important. Upper airway syndrome (elongated soft palate, narrow trachea) has been noted in the breed, though less commonly than in Norwich Terriers. Allergies and skin conditions may develop. Epilepsy has been reported in some lines. Responsible breeders screen for cardiac conditions, patellae, eyes, and hips.
health_el: Τα Νόρφολκ Τεριέ είναι γενικά υγιή ράτσα με τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 12–16 χρόνια. Η νόσος μιτροειδούς βαλβίδας (MVD) είναι η σημαντικότερη ανησυχία — τακτικός καρδιακός έλεγχος συνιστάται. Η εξάρθρωση επιγονατίδας είναι κοινή. Η δυσπλασία ισχίου μπορεί να εμφανιστεί. Ο καταρράκτης έχει τεκμηριωθεί. Η οδοντική νόσος είναι ανησυχία σε μικρές ράτσες. Αλλεργίες μπορεί να αναπτυχθούν. Η επιληψία έχει αναφερθεί. Οι υπεύθυνοι εκτροφείς ελέγχουν καρδιά, επιγονατίδα, μάτια και ισχία.

description_en: The Norwich Terrier is the prick-eared counterpart to the drop-eared Norfolk Terrier, both breeds sharing the same origin in East Anglia, England, where they were developed as versatile ratting and den-working terriers. Standing just 25 cm tall and weighing 5–5.5 kg, the Norwich is among the smallest of the working terriers, yet its upright, pointed ears give it a particularly alert, fox-like expression that distinguishes it from its Norfolk sibling. The breed gained early popularity at Cambridge University where students kept them as ratters in their dormitories, and one of the breed's founding dogs, a red dog named Rags, became the mascot of Norwich horsemen who used him for den work. Norwich Terriers are spirited, curious, and endlessly enthusiastic about life — they approach every day with a cheerful, can-do attitude that is infectious. They are among the most sociable terrier breeds, getting along well with people of all ages, other dogs, and often even cats. Despite their tiny size, they are hardy, athletic, and surprisingly tough — true working terriers in a compact, lovable package that adapts remarkably well to both country and city living.
description_el: Το Νόργουιτς Τεριέ είναι η ποικιλία με όρθια αυτιά που αντιστοιχεί στο Νόρφολκ με πεσμένα, μοιράζονται την ίδια καταγωγή στην East Anglia. Μόλις 25 εκ. ύψος και 5–5,5 κιλά, τα όρθια αυτιά δίνουν ιδιαίτερα επαγρύπνη έκφραση. Η ράτσα κέρδισε δημοτικότητα στο Πανεπιστήμιο Cambridge ως κυνηγοί αρουραίων. Τα Νόργουιτς είναι ζωηρά, περίεργα και γεμάτα ενθουσιασμό. Ανάμεσα στα πιο κοινωνικά τεριέ — τα πάνε καλά με ανθρώπους, σκυλιά, ακόμα και γάτες. Παρά το μικρό μέγεθος, είναι ανθεκτικά και αθλητικά που προσαρμόζονται εξαιρετικά σε πόλη και ύπαιθρο.
care_en: Norwich Terriers need moderate daily exercise — about 30–45 minutes of walks, play, and mental stimulation — and they enjoy earthdog trials, agility, and obedience. Their hard, wiry double coat requires weekly brushing and hand-stripping two to three times per year to maintain proper coat texture and remove dead hair. They are intelligent, eager to please, and respond well to positive training methods — they are among the most trainable and cooperative terrier breeds. Early socialization with various people, environments, and other animals helps develop their naturally confident, friendly temperament. They have a prey drive but generally coexist better with cats and small animals than many terrier breeds when raised together. They are excellent apartment dogs due to their small size and adaptable nature, but they need their daily exercise and mental engagement. They enjoy being part of family activities and do not do well when left alone for extended periods. They can be barkers — training a 'quiet' command early is recommended.
care_el: Τα Νόργουιτς Τεριέ χρειάζονται μέτρια καθημερινή άσκηση — 30–45 λεπτά βόλτων και παιχνιδιού. Το σκληρό τρίχωμα απαιτεί εβδομαδιαίο βούρτσισμα και hand-stripping 2–3 φορές τον χρόνο. Είναι πρόθυμα και ανταποκρίνονται καλά σε θετική εκπαίδευση. Η πρώιμη κοινωνικοποίηση βοηθά. Συνυπάρχουν καλύτερα με γάτες από πολλά τεριέ. Εξαιρετικά σκυλιά διαμερίσματος. Δεν πρέπει να μένουν μόνα πολύ. Μπορεί να γαβγίζουν.
health_en: Norwich Terriers are generally a healthy breed with a typical lifespan of 12–16 years. Upper airway syndrome (UAS) is the most significant breed-specific concern — Norwich Terriers are predisposed to elongated soft palate, narrow trachea, and everted laryngeal saccules, which can cause breathing difficulties, exercise intolerance, and snoring; severe cases may require surgical correction. Patellar luxation (slipping kneecaps) is a common orthopedic condition. Mitral valve disease (MVD) is a progressive heart condition — regular cardiac screening is recommended, especially in older dogs. Epilepsy has been documented in the breed and is considered a significant concern. Hip dysplasia can occur. Cataracts and other eye conditions should be screened for annually. Dental disease is a concern in small breeds — regular dental care and professional cleanings are important. Allergies and skin conditions may develop. Responsible breeders screen for cardiac conditions, patellae, eyes, hips, and are aware of UAS and epilepsy in their lines.
health_el: Τα Νόργουιτς Τεριέ είναι γενικά υγιή ράτσα με τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 12–16 χρόνια. Το σύνδρομο ανώτερων αεραγωγών (UAS) είναι η σημαντικότερη ανησυχία — μπορεί να προκαλέσει αναπνευστικές δυσκολίες. Η εξάρθρωση επιγονατίδας είναι κοινή. Η νόσος μιτροειδούς βαλβίδας (MVD) απαιτεί καρδιακό έλεγχο. Η επιληψία είναι σημαντική ανησυχία. Η δυσπλασία ισχίου μπορεί να εμφανιστεί. Ο καταρράκτης πρέπει να ελέγχεται. Η οδοντική νόσος είναι ανησυχία. Οι υπεύθυνοι εκτροφείς ελέγχουν καρδιά, επιγονατίδα, μάτια και ισχία.

description_en: The Parson Russell Terrier is the longer-legged, more refined variant of the terriers developed by the Reverend John Russell in 19th-century Devon, England. While the shorter-legged Jack Russell was bred to go underground, the Parson (standing 33–36 cm tall, weighing 6–8 kg) was specifically bred with longer legs to keep pace with hounds and horses during mounted foxhunts — their body had to be small enough to go to ground when needed, but their legs long enough to cover ground at speed across the rolling Devon and Somerset countryside. The breed standard emphasizes that the chest should be 'spannable' — small enough that a man's hands can encircle it behind the shoulders — ensuring the dog can enter a fox earth. Parsons are predominantly white with black, tan, or tricolor markings, athletic and square-proportioned with a keen, intelligent expression. They are energetic, bold, and clever dogs with the same irrepressible enthusiasm as the Jack Russell but with a slightly more refined, show-oriented appearance. They are friendly, devoted family dogs that thrive on human companionship and excel in a wide range of canine sports and activities.
description_el: Το Πάρσον Ράσελ Τεριέ είναι η variant με μακρύτερα πόδια των τεριέ του Αιδεσιμότατου John Russell. Εκτράφηκε ώστε τα πόδια να μπορούν να ακολουθούν κυνηγετικούς σκύλους και άλογα (33–36 εκ., 6–8 κιλά) — ενώ παράλληλα μπορεί να μπαίνει σε λαγούμια αλεπούδων. Είναι αθλητικά, κυρίως λευκά σκυλιά με ευφυή έκφραση. Είναι ενεργητικά, τολμηρά και έξυπνα με τον ίδιο ακατάσχετο ενθουσιασμό του Jack Russell αλλά πιο εκλεπτυσμένη εμφάνιση. Είναι φιλικά, αφοσιωμένα οικογενειακά σκυλιά που διαπρέπουν σε πολλά σπορ.
care_en: Parson Russell Terriers need substantial daily exercise — at least 1 to 1.5 hours of vigorous activity including walks, runs, hikes, and active play — and they excel in agility, flyball, earthdog trials, barn hunt, and obedience. Their coat comes in smooth or broken (slightly longer with some facial furnishings) varieties — both are easy to maintain with weekly brushing, and broken coats benefit from occasional hand-stripping. Training should be positive, consistent, and varied — Parsons are brilliant, quick learners but become bored and creative with repetitive exercises. Early, thorough socialization is essential, especially with other dogs, as they can be assertive and dog-selective. They have an extremely strong prey drive and will chase anything small that moves — secure fencing (they can jump and climb) and leash control are essential. They are vocal dogs with a keen alertness to their environment. They are not suited for sedentary households and can become destructive without sufficient physical and mental exercise. They adapt well to both rural and suburban life but truly shine when given a job to do.
care_el: Τα Πάρσον Ράσελ Τεριέ χρειάζονται σημαντική καθημερινή άσκηση — τουλάχιστον 1–1,5 ώρες — και διαπρέπουν σε αγωνίσματα. Το τρίχωμα είναι εύκολο στη συντήρηση. Η εκπαίδευση πρέπει να είναι θετική και ποικίλη. Η πρώιμη κοινωνικοποίηση είναι απαραίτητη. Έχουν εξαιρετικά ισχυρό ένστικτο θήρας. Η ασφαλής περίφραξη είναι κρίσιμη. Δεν ταιριάζουν σε αδρανή νοικοκυριά.
health_en: Parson Russell Terriers are generally a healthy, robust breed with a typical lifespan of 13–15 years. Primary lens luxation (PLL) is a significant breed-specific concern — a DNA test is available and all breeding dogs should be tested. Patellar luxation (slipping kneecaps) is a common orthopedic condition. Legg-Calve-Perthes disease can affect young dogs. Deafness can occur, particularly in predominantly white dogs — BAER testing is recommended for breeding stock. Congenital myasthenia gravis (neuromuscular disease) has been documented. Ataxia (loss of coordination) and spinocerebellar ataxia (late-onset) have been identified. Eye conditions including cataracts should be screened for annually. Allergies and skin conditions may develop. Von Willebrand's disease has been reported. The breed's overall robust health and longevity make them one of the healthier purebred dogs. Responsible breeders test for PLL, BAER, eyes, patellae, and cardiac function.
health_el: Τα Πάρσον Ράσελ Τεριέ είναι γενικά υγιή ράτσα με τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 13–15 χρόνια. Η PLL είναι σημαντική ανησυχία — υπάρχει τεστ DNA. Η εξάρθρωση επιγονατίδας είναι κοινή. Η νόσος Legg-Calve-Perthes μπορεί να εμφανιστεί. Η κώφωση μπορεί να εμφανιστεί — τεστ BAER συνιστάται. Η μυασθένεια gravis έχει τεκμηριωθεί. Αταξία έχει αναγνωριστεί. Οφθαλμικές παθήσεις πρέπει να ελέγχονται. Η ανθεκτική υγεία τους τα καθιστά από τα πιο υγιή καθαρόαιμα. Οι υπεύθυνοι εκτροφείς ελέγχουν PLL, BAER, μάτια, επιγονατίδα και καρδιά.

description_en: The Patterdale Terrier is a tough, compact working terrier that originated in the village of Patterdale in the Lake District of England, where they were bred specifically for the demanding task of going underground to bolt or dispatch foxes in the rocky, mountainous terrain of the Cumberland fells. Unlike the show-oriented Lakeland Terrier that shares the same geographic roots, the Patterdale was bred purely for working ability with no emphasis on appearance — function over form is the breed's guiding principle. They are small (5–6 kg, 25–38 cm tall), incredibly tough, and possess a work drive and determination that is legendary among terrier enthusiasts. Their coat comes in smooth, rough, or broken varieties, predominantly in black, chocolate, red, or black and tan. Patterdales are fearless, energetic, and intensely loyal — they will work tirelessly underground in conditions that would daunt larger, less determined breeds. As companions, they are devoted and affectionate with their families but retain an intensity and drive that makes them unsuitable for casual pet owners. They are not recognized by the UK or American Kennel Clubs (they are registered with the UKC) and are valued primarily as working dogs rather than show dogs.
description_el: Το Πάτερντεϊλ Τεριέ είναι ένα σκληρό, συμπαγές εργατικό τεριέ από το χωριό Patterdale στο Lake District, εκτρεφόμενο ειδικά για υπόγεια εκδίωξη αλεπούδων στο δύσκολο βραχώδες έδαφος. Σε αντίθεση με το Lakeland, εκτράφηκε αποκλειστικά για εργατική ικανότητα — η λειτουργία υπερτερεί. Είναι μικρά (5–6 κιλά), απίστευτα σκληρά. Το τρίχωμα έρχεται σε μαύρο, σοκολατί ή κόκκινο. Τα Πάτερντεϊλ είναι ατρόμητα, ενεργητικά και έντονα πιστά. Δεν αναγνωρίζονται από τα κύρια Kennel Clubs και εκτιμώνται κυρίως ως εργατικά σκυλιά.
care_en: Patterdale Terriers need substantial daily exercise — at least 1 to 1.5 hours of vigorous activity, and they truly thrive with a working role such as barn ratting, earthdog trials, or similar outlets for their intense drive. Their coat (smooth, rough, or broken) is extremely low-maintenance — weekly brushing suffices for all coat types. Training requires patience and understanding of the working terrier mentality — they are intelligent but can be independent and single-minded; positive, firm, consistent training is essential. Early, extensive socialization is critical, particularly with other dogs and small animals, as they have an extremely strong prey drive and potential for dog aggression. Secure fencing is absolutely essential — they are powerful diggers and will tunnel under fences in pursuit of quarry. They should never be trusted off-leash in unfenced areas. They can be vocal barkers. They are not ideal apartment dogs due to their high energy and drive, and they need an experienced, active owner who understands working terrier temperament. They bond deeply with their handler and can develop separation anxiety.
care_el: Τα Πάτερντεϊλ Τεριέ χρειάζονται σημαντική καθημερινή άσκηση — τουλάχιστον 1–1,5 ώρες. Το τρίχωμα είναι πολύ χαμηλής συντήρησης. Η εκπαίδευση απαιτεί υπομονή — έξυπνα αλλά ανεξάρτητα. Η πρώιμη κοινωνικοποίηση είναι κρίσιμη. Η ασφαλής περίφραξη είναι απολύτως αναγκαία — θα σκάψουν κάτω. Δεν πρέπει ποτέ να αφήνονται ελεύθερα. Δεν είναι ιδανικά σκυλιά διαμερίσματος. Χρειάζονται έμπειρο ιδιοκτήτη.
health_en: Patterdale Terriers are generally a very robust, hardy breed with a typical lifespan of 11–13 years — their working heritage has naturally selected for health and soundness. Eye conditions including primary lens luxation (PLL) and cataracts can occur — PLL DNA testing is available and recommended for breeding stock. Patellar luxation may affect some individuals. Hip dysplasia is occasionally seen. Dental disease should be monitored, particularly in older dogs. Skin conditions and allergies can develop. Due to the breed's emphasis on working ability over pedigree, they tend to have fewer genetic health issues than many more intensively bred terrier breeds. However, because they are not a recognized breed by major kennel clubs, there is less formal health screening data available. Injuries from working (cuts, sprains, punctures) are common in dogs that are actively worked underground. Responsible breeders are encouraged to test for PLL, eyes, and patellae.
health_el: Τα Πάτερντεϊλ Τεριέ είναι γενικά πολύ ανθεκτική ράτσα με τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 11–13 χρόνια — η εργατική κληρονομιά τους έχει επιλέξει φυσικά υγεία. Η PLL και ο καταρράκτης μπορεί να εμφανιστούν — τεστ DNA συνιστάται. Η εξάρθρωση επιγονατίδας μπορεί να εμφανιστεί. Η δυσπλασία ισχίου εμφανίζεται περιστασιακά. Η οδοντική νόσος πρέπει να παρακολουθείται. Λόγω έμφασης στην εργασία, τείνουν να έχουν λιγότερα γενετικά προβλήματα. Τραυματισμοί από εργασία είναι κοινοί σε ενεργά εργαζόμενα σκυλιά.

description_en: The Rat Terrier is a quintessentially American breed, developed on farms throughout the United States in the late 19th and early 20th centuries from a mixture of Smooth Fox Terriers, old-style Manchester Terriers, Beagles, Whippets, Italian Greyhounds, and other terrier breeds. The breed's name is popularly attributed to President Theodore Roosevelt, who reportedly named his terrier after it rid the White House of a rat infestation. Rat Terriers were invaluable farm dogs across America, controlling the rat and vermin populations that plagued grain stores and barns — they were so common on American farms that they were sometimes called 'the poor man's dog.' They come in two sizes: Miniature (25–33 cm) and Standard (33–46 cm), weighing 4.5–11 kg, with a short, smooth coat in various bi-color and tri-color patterns always with white. They are alert, friendly, and remarkably intelligent dogs with an easygoing, adaptable temperament that makes them excellent family companions. Rat Terriers are one of the most versatile terrier breeds — they are equally at home on the farm, in the city apartment, in the agility ring, or as therapy dogs. Their exceptional longevity (15–18 years) makes them one of the longest-lived dog breeds.
description_el: Το Ρατ Τεριέ είναι αυθεντικά αμερικανική ράτσα, αναπτυγμένη σε αγροκτήματα στις ΗΠΑ. Το όνομα αποδίδεται στον Πρόεδρο Theodore Roosevelt. Ήταν ανεκτίμητα αγροτικά σκυλιά σε όλη την Αμερική για έλεγχο τρωκτικών. Έρχονται σε δύο μεγέθη: Miniature (25–33 εκ.) και Standard (33–46 εκ.), 4,5–11 κιλά, με κοντό τρίχωμα. Είναι επαγρύπνα, φιλικά και αξιοσημείωτα έξυπνα με εύκολη, προσαρμοστική ιδιοσυγκρασία. Ένα από τα πιο ευέλικτα τεριέ — εξίσου στο σπίτι, στο διαμέρισμα ή στο agility. Η εξαιρετική μακροζωία τους (15–18 χρόνια) τα καθιστά από τα μακροβιότερα σκυλιά.
care_en: Rat Terriers need regular daily exercise — about 30–60 minutes of walks, play, and mental stimulation — and they enjoy agility, barn hunt, lure coursing, and interactive games. Their short, smooth coat is very easy to maintain with weekly brushing and occasional bathing. They do shed moderately, particularly seasonally. They are highly intelligent, eager to please, and among the most trainable of the terrier breeds — positive reinforcement training produces excellent results, and they excel in obedience and trick training. Early socialization is important but generally straightforward as they have a naturally friendly, outgoing temperament. They generally get along well with other dogs and can coexist with cats when raised together. They have a prey drive and will chase small animals outdoors. They are excellent apartment dogs due to their adaptable nature and moderate exercise needs. They are social dogs that bond closely with their families and prefer not to be left alone for extended periods. They can be good watchdogs with appropriate alertness.
care_el: Τα Ρατ Τεριέ χρειάζονται τακτική καθημερινή άσκηση — 30–60 λεπτά βόλτων και παιχνιδιού. Το κοντό τρίχωμα είναι πολύ εύκολο στη συντήρηση. Είναι πολύ έξυπνα και πρόθυμα — ανάμεσα στα πιο εκπαιδεύσιμα τεριέ. Η πρώιμη κοινωνικοποίηση είναι εύκολη λόγω φιλικής ιδιοσυγκρασίας. Τα πάνε γενικά καλά με σκυλιά και γάτες. Εξαιρετικά σκυλιά διαμερίσματος. Δεν πρέπει να μένουν μόνα πολύ.
health_en: Rat Terriers are generally an extremely healthy, long-lived breed with a typical lifespan of 15–18 years — among the longest of any dog breed. Patellar luxation (slipping kneecaps) is the most common orthopedic concern. Hip dysplasia can occur, particularly in the larger Standard variety. Legg-Calve-Perthes disease has been documented in younger dogs. Primary lens luxation (PLL) is an eye concern — DNA testing is available. Progressive retinal atrophy (PRA) and cataracts should be screened for. Cardiac conditions including patent ductus arteriosus have been reported. Allergies and skin conditions can develop. Dental disease should be monitored in the Miniature variety. Color dilution alopecia can affect dogs with dilute (blue) coat colors. Hypothyroidism may develop with age. Demodectic mange can affect puppies. Their hybrid vigor from diverse ancestry contributes to their exceptional health and longevity. Responsible breeders test for PLL, eyes, patellae, cardiac, and hips.
health_el: Τα Ρατ Τεριέ είναι γενικά εξαιρετικά υγιή ράτσα με τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 15–18 χρόνια — ανάμεσα στις μεγαλύτερες. Η εξάρθρωση επιγονατίδας είναι η πιο κοινή ανησυχία. Η δυσπλασία ισχίου μπορεί να εμφανιστεί στο Standard. Η νόσος Legg-Calve-Perthes έχει τεκμηριωθεί. Η PLL είναι οφθαλμική ανησυχία — υπάρχει τεστ DNA. PRA και καταρράκτης πρέπει να ελέγχονται. Αλλεργίες μπορεί να αναπτυχθούν. Η αλωπεκία αραίωσης χρώματος μπορεί να επηρεάσει σκυλιά μπλε χρώματος. Ο υβριδικός σφρίγος συμβάλλει στην εξαιρετική υγεία τους.

description_en: The Scottish Terrier, or 'Scottie,' is one of the most iconic and recognizable dog breeds in the world, with a distinctive silhouette featuring a long head, erect ears, prominent eyebrows, and a compact body on short legs that has been immortalized in everything from the Monopoly board game piece to the Scottie dog logo. Originating in the Scottish Highlands, Scotties are among the oldest of the Highland terrier breeds, developed to hunt foxes, badgers, and vermin in the rocky terrain. They are compact, solidly built dogs (8.5–10 kg) with a hard, wiry outer coat and soft undercoat, typically in black (the most iconic color), but also wheaten and brindle. Three US Presidents — Franklin D. Roosevelt, Dwight D. Eisenhower, and George W. Bush — famously owned Scottish Terriers, with Roosevelt's Fala being perhaps the most famous presidential pet in American history. Scotties are independent, dignified, and alert dogs with a personality often described as 'big dog in a small dog's body.' They are loyal and deeply devoted to their families but reserved and discerning with strangers — they do not give their affection freely, but when earned, their devotion is absolute.
description_el: Το Σκωτσέζικο Τεριέ, ή «Scottie», είναι μία από τις πιο εμβληματικές ράτσες, με χαρακτηριστική σιλουέτα αθανατισμένη στο Monopoly. Από τα Σκωτσέζικα Υψίπεδα, ανάμεσα στα παλαιότερα τεριέ, αναπτυγμένα για κυνήγι αλεπούδων και ασβών. Είναι συμπαγή σκυλιά (8,5–10 κιλά) σε μαύρο, σιτάρι ή brindle. Τρεις Αμερικανοί Πρόεδροι κατείχαν Scotties — ο Fala του Roosevelt είναι ίσως το πιο διάσημο προεδρικό κατοικίδιο. Τα Scotties είναι ανεξάρτητα, αξιοπρεπή σκυλιά — «μεγάλο σκυλί σε μικρό σώμα». Πιστά και αφοσιωμένα στις οικογένειές τους αλλά επιφυλακτικά με ξένους.
care_en: Scottish Terriers need moderate daily exercise — about 30–45 minutes of walks and play — and while they are not as high-energy as many terrier breeds, they still enjoy active play and exploring. Their hard, wiry double coat requires professional grooming (hand-stripping or clipping) every 6–8 weeks plus weekly brushing to prevent matting. Training requires patience, humor, and understanding of the Scottie temperament — they are highly intelligent but famously independent and stubborn; positive, reward-based methods work best, and they should never be trained with harsh methods. Early socialization is important, particularly with other dogs, as Scotties can be dog-aggressive and territorial. They may not be suitable households with very small children due to their independent nature and tendency to be assertive. They have a moderate prey drive and will chase small animals. They can be vocal barkers. They are excellent apartment dogs due to their moderate size and energy, and they are clean, dignified indoor companions. They bond deeply with one or two primary people in the household.
care_el: Τα Σκωτσέζικα Τεριέ χρειάζονται μέτρια καθημερινή άσκηση — 30–45 λεπτά βόλτων. Το σκληρό τρίχωμα απαιτεί επαγγελματική περιποίηση κάθε 6–8 εβδομάδες συν εβδομαδιαίο βούρτσισμα. Η εκπαίδευση απαιτεί υπομονή — ανεξάρτητα και πεισματάρικα αλλά ποτέ σκληρή εκπαίδευση. Η πρώιμη κοινωνικοποίηση είναι σημαντική λόγω πιθανής επιθετικότητας. Μπορεί να γαβγίζουν. Εξαιρετικά σκυλιά διαμερίσματος. Δένονται βαθιά με ένα ή δύο άτομα.
health_en: Scottish Terriers have a typical lifespan of 11–13 years. Transitional cell carcinoma (TCC) or bladder cancer is a significant breed-specific concern — Scotties have an 18-fold higher risk of developing this cancer compared to other breeds; monitoring for signs like blood in urine or frequent urination is important. Scottie cramp is a breed-specific movement disorder causing episodes of muscle stiffness and cramping during exercise or excitement — it is uncomfortable but not life-threatening. Von Willebrand's disease (vWD), a hereditary bleeding disorder, is present in the breed — a DNA test is available. Craniomandibular osteopathy (CMO or 'lion jaw') — abnormal bone growth in the jaw — can affect puppies but usually resolves. Hypothyroidism is common in the breed. Cushing's disease (hyperadrenocorticism) has been reported at higher rates. Progressive retinal atrophy (PRA) and cataracts are eye concerns. Patellar luxation can occur. Hemangiosarcoma and lymphoma are cancers that occur at elevated rates. Responsible breeders test for vWD, CMO, eyes, and patellae.
health_el: Τα Σκωτσέζικα Τεριέ έχουν τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 11–13 χρόνια. Το καρκίνωμα μεταβατικών κυττάρων (καρκίνος ουροδόχου) είναι σημαντική ανησυχία — 18πλάσιος κίνδυνος. Η κράμπα Scottie είναι κινητική διαταραχή ειδική ράτσας. Η νόσος von Willebrand υπάρχει — τεστ DNA. Η κρανιογναθική οστεοπάθεια μπορεί να επηρεάσει κουτάβια. Ο υποθυρεοειδισμός είναι κοινός. Η νόσος Cushing έχει αναφερθεί. PRA και καταρράκτης είναι ανησυχίες. Αιμαγγειοσάρκωμα και λέμφωμα εμφανίζονται σε αυξημένα ποσοστά. Οι υπεύθυνοι εκτροφείς ελέγχουν vWD, μάτια και επιγονατίδα.

description_en: The Sealyham Terrier was developed between 1850 and 1891 by Captain John Edwardes at his Sealyham estate in Haverfordwest, Pembrokeshire, Wales. Edwardes meticulously bred his terriers by crossing various breeds including the Dandie Dinmont Terrier, West Highland White Terrier, Corgi, Bull Terrier, and Fox Terrier to create the ideal dog for hunting otters, badgers, and foxes alongside his pack of Otterhounds — only dogs that proved their courage and ability in the field were allowed to breed. The result is a small (10–11 kg), sturdy, powerfully built white terrier with a long, broad head, a dense wiry coat, and a confident, spirited personality. Sealyhams were once among the most popular terriers — owned by Hollywood stars like Alfred Hitchcock, Humphrey Bogart, Cary Grant, and Princess Margaret, and winning Best in Show at Westminster four times. Tragically, the breed has declined dramatically and is now one of the rarest terrier breeds, classified as a Vulnerable Native Breed by the Kennel Club with fewer than 50 puppies registered annually in the UK. Despite their rarity, Sealyhams remain charming, spirited companions — calm and dignified at home while retaining their terrier fire when aroused.
description_el: Το Σίλιχαμ Τεριέ αναπτύχθηκε μεταξύ 1850 και 1891 από τον Captain John Edwardes στο κτήμα Sealyham στην Ουαλία, διασταυρώνοντας διάφορες ράτσες για το ιδανικό κυνηγετικό τεριέ. Είναι μικρό (10–11 κιλά), γερό λευκό τεριέ με μακρύ κεφάλι και σκληρό τρίχωμα. Κάποτε από τα πιο δημοφιλή τεριέ — ανήκε σε σταρ του Hollywood όπως ο Hitchcock και ο Bogart. Δυστυχώς, η ράτσα έχει μειωθεί δραματικά — λιγότερα από 50 κουτάβια ετησίως στο ΗΒ. Παραμένουν γοητευτικοί, ζωηροί σύντροφοι — ήρεμοι στο σπίτι αλλά με τεριέ πνεύμα.
care_en: Sealyham Terriers need moderate daily exercise — about 30–45 minutes of walks and play — and they are one of the calmer terrier breeds, content with a moderate activity level. Their dense, wiry white coat requires professional grooming (hand-stripping or clipping) every 6–8 weeks and brushing two to three times per week to prevent matting and keep the coat clean. Their white coat can show dirt easily. Training should be positive and patient — Sealyhams are intelligent but can be independent and stubborn; they respond well to varied, engaging exercises and treats. Early socialization with people, dogs, and various environments is important. They generally get along well with other dogs and can be good with children. They are excellent apartment dogs due to their calm indoor demeanor and moderate exercise needs. They can be barkers — they have a deep, impressive bark for their size that makes them effective watchdogs. They enjoy food and can be prone to weight gain, so monitoring diet is important.
care_el: Τα Σίλιχαμ Τεριέ χρειάζονται μέτρια καθημερινή άσκηση — 30–45 λεπτά. Το σκληρό λευκό τρίχωμα απαιτεί επαγγελματική περιποίηση κάθε 6–8 εβδομάδες συν βούρτσισμα 2–3 φορές. Η εκπαίδευση πρέπει να είναι θετική και υπομονετική. Η πρώιμη κοινωνικοποίηση είναι σημαντική. Εξαιρετικά σκυλιά διαμερίσματος. Μπορεί να γαβγίζουν με βαθιά φωνή. Μπορεί να πάρουν βάρος — παρακολούθηση διατροφής.
health_en: Sealyham Terriers have a typical lifespan of 12–14 years. Primary lens luxation (PLL) is a significant breed-specific eye condition — the lens dislocates, potentially causing secondary glaucoma; a DNA test is available and all breeding dogs should be tested. Retinal dysplasia has been documented in the breed. Deafness can occur, particularly given their white coat — BAER testing is recommended. Allergies and skin conditions are relatively common, especially in white-coated dogs. Intervertebral disc disease (IVDD) can occur due to their relatively long back. Hypothyroidism may develop. Cardiac conditions should be monitored. The breed's extreme rarity poses challenges for maintaining genetic diversity — careful breeding practices are essential to preserve breed health. Despite these concerns, Sealyhams are generally considered a robust, healthy breed. Responsible breeders test for PLL, BAER, eyes, and retinal dysplasia.
health_el: Τα Σίλιχαμ Τεριέ έχουν τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 12–14 χρόνια. Η PLL είναι σημαντική ανησυχία — υπάρχει τεστ DNA. Η δυσπλασία αμφιβληστροειδούς έχει τεκμηριωθεί. Η κώφωση μπορεί να εμφανιστεί — τεστ BAER συνιστάται. Αλλεργίες είναι σχετικά κοινές. Η IVDD μπορεί να εμφανιστεί λόγω μακράς πλάτης. Ο υποθυρεοειδισμός μπορεί να αναπτυχθεί. Η σπανιότητα δημιουργεί πρόκληση γενετικής ποικιλομορφίας. Οι υπεύθυνοι εκτροφείς ελέγχουν PLL, BAER, μάτια και δυσπλασία αμφιβληστροειδούς.

description_en: The Skye Terrier is one of the oldest and most endangered terrier breeds, originating on the rugged Isle of Skye off the northwestern coast of Scotland, where they were developed to hunt foxes, badgers, and otters among the rocky cairns and cliffs. They are immediately recognizable by their unique silhouette — long, low to the ground (twice as long as they are tall), and draped in a spectacular flowing double coat that hangs straight down on either side of the body like a curtain, with a distinctive veil of hair falling over their eyes. They weigh 11–14 kg and stand only 25 cm tall. The Skye Terrier is perhaps most famous through the legendary story of Greyfriars Bobby, a Skye Terrier (or possibly a Dandie Dinmont) in Edinburgh who reportedly guarded his master's grave for 14 years after his death in 1858 — a statue of Bobby stands to this day at Greyfriars Kirkyard. Queen Victoria was a devoted admirer of the breed. Skye Terriers are loyal, dignified, and courageous dogs that form an intensely deep bond with their chosen person. They are critically endangered — the Kennel Club registers fewer than 30 puppies per year, making them rarer than many wild animal species.
description_el: Το Σκάι Τεριέ είναι μία από τις παλαιότερες και πιο απειλούμενες ράτσες τεριέ, από τη Νήσο Σκάι. Αναγνωρίζονται αμέσως — μακριά, χαμηλά, ντυμένα σε εντυπωσιακό μακρύ τρίχωμα που πέφτει σαν κουρτίνα. Ζυγίζουν 11–14 κιλά. Η ράτσα είναι διάσημη μέσω του θρυλικού Greyfriars Bobby στο Εδιμβούργο που φύλαγε τον τάφο του αφεντικού του 14 χρόνια. Η Βασίλισσα Βικτωρία θαύμαζε τη ράτσα. Τα Σκάι είναι πιστά, αξιοπρεπή σκυλιά που δημιουργούν βαθύ δεσμό με ένα άτομο. Κριτικά απειλούμενα — λιγότερα από 30 κουτάβια ετησίως.
care_en: Skye Terriers need moderate daily exercise — about 30–45 minutes of walks and play — and while they enjoy outdoor activity, they are not as high-energy as many terrier breeds. Their spectacular long, flat double coat requires significant grooming commitment — daily brushing or at minimum every other day to prevent matting, with particular attention to the areas behind the ears and under the legs. The coat parts naturally along the spine and should hang straight down. Professional grooming is recommended periodically. Training requires patience and understanding — Skyes are intelligent but independent and can be stubborn; they respond best to gentle, positive methods and building a strong bond of trust. Early, patient socialization is critical — they are naturally reserved with strangers and can be cautious in new situations. They generally do best as the only dog in a household, though they can get along with dogs they are raised with. Due to their long backs, they should be discouraged from jumping on and off furniture, and puppies under 8 months should not do excessive stair climbing to protect developing joints. They bond very deeply with one person and can suffer from separation anxiety.
care_el: Τα Σκάι Τεριέ χρειάζονται μέτρια καθημερινή άσκηση — 30–45 λεπτά. Το μακρύ τρίχωμα απαιτεί σημαντική φροντίδα — καθημερινό βούρτσισμα. Η εκπαίδευση απαιτεί υπομονή — ανεξάρτητα αλλά ανταποκρίνονται σε ήπιες μεθόδους. Η πρώιμη κοινωνικοποίηση είναι κρίσιμη — φυσικά επιφυλακτικά με ξένους. Γενικά καλύτερα ως μοναδικό σκυλί. Λόγω μακράς πλάτης, αποφυγή αλμάτων. Δένονται βαθιά με ένα άτομο.
health_en: Skye Terriers have a typical lifespan of 12–14 years. Premature closure of the growth plates in the radius and ulna (foreleg bones) can cause limping and lameness in puppies — this is why puppies under 8 months should be protected from excessive jumping and stair climbing. Intervertebral disc disease (IVDD) is a concern due to their elongated spine — weight management and preventing jumping help reduce risk. Mammary cancer has been reported at higher rates in the breed, particularly in unspayed females. Hypothyroidism can develop. Autoimmune conditions including hemolytic anemia and hepatitis have been documented. Allergies and skin conditions can develop, often requiring dietary management. Renal dysplasia (abnormal kidney development) has been reported in some lines. Dental disease should be monitored. Due to the breed's critical rarity, the gene pool is extremely small, making genetic diversity a paramount concern for breeders. Responsible breeders work to maintain genetic diversity while screening for orthopedic development, thyroid, and autoimmune conditions.
health_el: Τα Σκάι Τεριέ έχουν τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 12–14 χρόνια. Η πρόωρη σύγκλειση αυξητικών πλακών μπορεί να προκαλέσει χωλότητα σε κουτάβια. Η IVDD είναι ανησυχία λόγω μακράς σπονδυλικής στήλης. Ο καρκίνος μαστού εμφανίζεται σε υψηλότερα ποσοστά. Ο υποθυρεοειδισμός μπορεί να αναπτυχθεί. Αυτοάνοσες παθήσεις έχουν τεκμηριωθεί. Αλλεργίες μπορεί να αναπτυχθούν. Λόγω κρίσιμης σπανιότητας, η γενετική ποικιλομορφία είναι πρωταρχική ανησυχία.

description_en: The Soft Coated Wheaten Terrier is one of four native Irish terrier breeds (alongside the Irish Terrier, Kerry Blue, and Glen of Imaal), believed to be the oldest of the group with a history spanning over 200 years as the versatile farm dog of the Irish peasantry. Too humble to be owned by the gentry (who preferred setters and hounds), the Wheaten was the poor farmer's all-purpose dog — herding cattle and sheep, guarding the farm, hunting vermin and rabbits, and even serving as a companion to the family. They are medium-sized dogs (14–18 kg) distinguished by their beautiful, soft, silky, gently waving coat in a warm wheaten color (ranging from pale beige to shimmering gold) that does not shed heavily, making them a popular choice for allergy sufferers. Puppies are born dark and their coat gradually lightens to the adult wheaten color over the first two years. Wheatens are known for their exuberant, joyful personality — they greet everyone with what enthusiasts call the 'Wheaten Greetin',' an enthusiastic, bouncy welcome that involves jumping and spinning with unbridled joy. They are the most friendly and outgoing of the Irish terrier breeds, making them excellent family companions.
description_el: Το Σοφτ Κόουτεντ Γουίτεν Τεριέ είναι ένα από τα τέσσερα ιρλανδικά τεριέ, πιθανώς το παλαιότερο, με ιστορία 200+ χρόνων ως πανεπιστημιακό αγροτικό σκυλί. Ήταν το σκυλί του φτωχού αγρότη — βοσκός, φύλακας, κυνηγός. Μεσαία σκυλιά (14–18 κιλά) με μαλακό, μεταξένιο τρίχωμα σε ζεστό χρώμα σιταριού. Τα κουτάβια γεννιούνται σκούρα και ανοίγουν. Γνωστά για τη χαρούμενη προσωπικότητα — χαιρετούν με «Wheaten Greetin'», ενθουσιώδη πηδήματα χαράς. Τα πιο φιλικά από τα ιρλανδικά τεριέ.
care_en: Soft Coated Wheaten Terriers need regular daily exercise — about 45–60 minutes of walks, play, and interactive activities — and they enjoy agility, herding, obedience, and tracking. Their soft, silky coat requires significant grooming commitment — daily brushing with a medium-toothed comb to prevent matting (their coat mats very easily, particularly behind the ears, under the legs, and in the belly area) and professional grooming every 4–6 weeks. The coat does not shed heavily but requires regular trimming to maintain a neat appearance. Training should be positive, consistent, and engaging — Wheatens are intelligent and generally eager to please but can be headstrong; they respond well to reward-based methods. Early socialization is important, and their naturally friendly temperament makes this relatively easy. They generally get along well with other dogs and children. The 'Wheaten Greetin'' (enthusiastic jumping greeting) should be managed through training if it becomes problematic. They are considered hypoallergenic due to their low-shedding coat. They adapt well to various living situations but need daily exercise.
care_el: Τα Σοφτ Κόουτεντ Γουίτεν Τεριέ χρειάζονται τακτική καθημερινή άσκηση — 45–60 λεπτά. Το μαλακό τρίχωμα απαιτεί σημαντική φροντίδα — καθημερινό χτένισμα και επαγγελματική περιποίηση κάθε 4–6 εβδομάδες. Η εκπαίδευση πρέπει να είναι θετική — πρόθυμα αλλά ισχυρογνώμονα. Η πρώιμη κοινωνικοποίηση είναι εύκολη λόγω φιλικής φύσης. Τα πάνε καλά με σκυλιά και παιδιά. Θεωρούνται υποαλλεργικά. Προσαρμόζονται σε διάφορες συνθήκες.
health_en: Soft Coated Wheaten Terriers have a typical lifespan of 12–15 years. Protein-losing nephropathy (PLN) and protein-losing enteropathy (PLE) are the most significant breed-specific conditions — both involve abnormal loss of protein, through the kidneys (PLN) or intestines (PLE), and can be serious or fatal; regular monitoring of urine protein levels and blood albumin is recommended. Addison's disease (hypoadrenocorticism) occurs at higher rates in Wheatens than in most breeds and can be life-threatening if undiagnosed but is manageable with lifelong medication once identified. Renal dysplasia (abnormal kidney development) has been documented. Hip dysplasia can occur — OFA screening is recommended. Allergies, particularly food allergies, are relatively common. Progressive retinal atrophy (PRA) and cataracts are eye concerns. Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) can contribute to PLE symptoms. The breed club actively supports research into PLN/PLE and recommends annual health screening. Responsible breeders test for PLN/PLE markers, Addison's, hips, eyes, and kidneys.
health_el: Τα Σοφτ Κόουτεντ Γουίτεν Τεριέ έχουν τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 12–15 χρόνια. Η νεφροπάθεια (PLN) και η εντεροπάθεια (PLE) απώλειας πρωτεΐνης είναι οι σημαντικότερες παθήσεις — τακτική παρακολούθηση συνιστάται. Η νόσος Addison εμφανίζεται σε υψηλότερα ποσοστά — απειλητική αν δεν διαγνωστεί αλλά διαχειρίσιμη. Η νεφρική δυσπλασία έχει τεκμηριωθεί. Η δυσπλασία ισχίου μπορεί να εμφανιστεί. Αλλεργίες τροφής είναι κοινές. PRA και καταρράκτης είναι ανησυχίες. Οι υπεύθυνοι εκτροφείς ελέγχουν PLN/PLE, Addison, ισχία, μάτια και νεφρά.

description_en: The Staffordshire Bull Terrier was developed in the Black Country of Staffordshire, England, in the early 19th century by crossing Bulldogs with various terrier breeds to create dogs for the then-popular (but now banned) sport of bull-baiting and later dog fighting. When these cruel sports were outlawed in 1835, the breed's devoted admirers worked to transform the Staffie into a companion dog, and the Kennel Club recognized the breed in 1935. Despite their fighting heritage, well-bred modern Staffordshire Bull Terriers are among the most people-oriented and affectionate of all dog breeds — the breed standard itself describes them as possessing 'total reliability' with children, and they have historically been known as 'nanny dogs' for their gentle, patient nature with children. They are compact, muscular dogs (11–17 kg) with a broad head, strong jaw, and short, smooth coat in a wide variety of colors. Staffies are the most popular breed in the United Kingdom by registration numbers and are deeply ingrained in British culture, particularly in working-class communities. They are brave, intelligent, and loyal with an irrepressible enthusiasm for life and a characteristic 'Staffie smile' that wins hearts everywhere. They are subject to breed-specific legislation in some countries.
description_el: Το Στάφορντσιρ Μπουλ Τεριέ αναπτύχθηκε στο Staffordshire της Αγγλίας τον 19ο αιώνα. Παρά τη μαχητική κληρονομιά, τα σύγχρονα Staffies είναι ανάμεσα στα πιο ανθρωποκεντρικά σκυλιά — γνωστά ως «nanny dogs» για την υπομονή τους με παιδιά. Είναι συμπαγή, μυώδη σκυλιά (11–17 κιλά). Η πιο δημοφιλής ράτσα στο ΗΒ, βαθιά ενσωματωμένη στην βρετανική κουλτούρα. Είναι γενναία, έξυπνα και πιστά με ακατάσχετο ενθουσιασμό και χαρακτηριστικό «Staffie χαμόγελο». Υπόκεινται σε νομοθεσία ειδική ράτσας σε ορισμένες χώρες.
care_en: Staffordshire Bull Terriers need regular daily exercise — about 1 hour of walks, play, and mental stimulation — and they enjoy agility, weight-pulling, obedience, flyball, and interactive games. Their short, smooth coat is very easy to maintain with weekly brushing and occasional bathing. Training should be positive, consistent, and engaging — Staffies are intelligent, eager to please, and respond wonderfully to reward-based methods; harsh training is counterproductive with this sensitive breed. Early, extensive, and ongoing socialization is essential — particularly with other dogs, as Staffies can be dog-aggressive, especially with dogs of the same sex. They are typically excellent with children and adults of all ages. They thrive as indoor family dogs and should not be kept outside or isolated — they are people dogs that need to be part of family life. They can be strong and exuberant, so leash manners are important. They are heat and cold sensitive due to their short coat. Check local breed-specific legislation before acquiring one.
care_el: Τα Στάφορντσιρ Μπουλ Τεριέ χρειάζονται τακτική καθημερινή άσκηση — περίπου 1 ώρα. Το κοντό τρίχωμα είναι πολύ εύκολο στη συντήρηση. Η εκπαίδευση πρέπει να είναι θετική — ευαίσθητα σε σκληρές μεθόδους. Η πρώιμη κοινωνικοποίηση είναι απαραίτητη, ειδικά με σκυλιά. Εξαιρετικά με παιδιά. Ευδοκιμούν ως μέλη οικογένειας — δεν πρέπει να απομονώνονται. Ευαίσθητα στη ζέστη και το κρύο. Ελέγξτε τοπική νομοθεσία.
health_en: Staffordshire Bull Terriers are generally a robust, healthy breed with a typical lifespan of 12–14 years. L-2-Hydroxyglutaric Aciduria (L-2-HGA) is a metabolic disorder causing neurological symptoms including seizures, tremors, and behavioral changes — a DNA test is available and all breeding dogs should be tested. Hereditary cataracts (HC) are a significant eye concern — a DNA test exists and regular eye examinations are recommended. Hip dysplasia can occur and OFA screening is recommended. Patellar luxation (slipping kneecaps) is a common orthopedic concern. Persistent hyperplastic primary vitreous (PHPV) is an eye condition that can occur. Skin allergies, including demodectic mange in puppies and atopic dermatitis, are relatively common. Mast cell tumors are the most common skin cancer in the breed. Elbow dysplasia has been documented. Cruciate ligament injuries can occur in active dogs. The breed is generally considered one of the healthier bull-type breeds. Responsible breeders test for L-2-HGA, HC (DNA tests), hips, and eyes.
health_el: Τα Στάφορντσιρ Μπουλ Τεριέ είναι γενικά ανθεκτική ράτσα με τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 12–14 χρόνια. Η L-2-HGA είναι μεταβολική διαταραχή — υπάρχει τεστ DNA. Ο κληρονομικός καταρράκτης (HC) είναι σημαντική ανησυχία — τεστ DNA υπάρχει. Η δυσπλασία ισχίου μπορεί να εμφανιστεί. Η εξάρθρωση επιγονατίδας είναι κοινή. Δερματικές αλλεργίες είναι σχετικά κοινές. Οι μαστοκυτταρικοί όγκοι είναι ο πιο κοινός καρκίνος δέρματος. Οι υπεύθυνοι εκτροφείς ελέγχουν L-2-HGA, HC, ισχία και μάτια.

description_en: The Welsh Terrier is one of the oldest terrier breeds, with evidence of similar black-and-tan wire-coated terriers existing in Wales as far back as the 13th century. Originally known as the Old English Wire Haired Black and Tan Terrier, they were prized by Welsh farmers and huntsmen for their ability to hunt foxes, badgers, and otters in the rugged Welsh countryside and along riverbanks. The Welsh Terrier is often described as looking like a compact, smaller version of the Airedale Terrier (to which they are not directly related), standing about 39 cm tall and weighing 9–10 kg with a distinctive dense, wiry, black-and-tan jacket. They are friendly, spirited, and alert dogs with a happy, outgoing personality that distinguishes them from some of the more reserved terrier breeds. Welsh Terriers retain their working terrier spirit while being generally more sociable and good-natured than many of their terrier cousins. President John F. Kennedy owned a Welsh Terrier named Charlie who became one of the best-known White House dogs. They are adaptable, intelligent dogs that make excellent companions for active families who can provide the exercise and mental stimulation they need.
description_el: Το Ουαλικό Τεριέ είναι μία από τις παλαιότερες ράτσες τεριέ, με στοιχεία παρόμοιων τεριέ στην Ουαλία από τον 13ο αιώνα. Εκτιμούνταν για κυνήγι αλεπούδων, ασβών και βιδρών. Μοιάζει με συμπαγή μικρότερη εκδοχή του Airedale (39 εκ., 9–10 κιλά) με σκληρό μαύρο-καφέ τρίχωμα. Είναι φιλικά, ζωηρά με χαρούμενη προσωπικότητα — πιο κοινωνικά από πολλά τεριέ. Ο Πρόεδρος Kennedy κατείχε ένα Ουαλικό Τεριέ ονόματι Charlie. Είναι προσαρμοστικά, έξυπνα σκυλιά εξαιρετικά για ενεργές οικογένειες.
care_en: Welsh Terriers need regular daily exercise — about 45–60 minutes of walks, play, and mental stimulation — and they enjoy agility, earthdog trials, barn hunt, and hiking. Their dense, wiry black-and-tan coat requires professional hand-stripping every 8–12 weeks to maintain proper coat texture and color (clipping is acceptable for pets but softens the coat), plus weekly brushing at home. They are intelligent and reasonably trainable for a terrier — positive, varied training methods with patience produce good results, though they retain some terrier stubbornness. Early socialization with various people, dogs, and environments is important — they generally have a friendlier disposition with other dogs than many terrier breeds but can be assertive. They have a moderate to strong prey drive and will chase small animals. They adapt reasonably well to apartment living with sufficient exercise. They can be vocal barkers. They are generally good with children and make affectionate family companions. Their beard and facial furnishings should be cleaned regularly after meals.
care_el: Τα Ουαλικά Τεριέ χρειάζονται τακτική καθημερινή άσκηση — 45–60 λεπτά. Το σκληρό τρίχωμα απαιτεί hand-stripping κάθε 8–12 εβδομάδες συν εβδομαδιαίο βούρτσισμα. Η εκπαίδευση πρέπει να είναι θετική με ποικιλία. Η πρώιμη κοινωνικοποίηση είναι σημαντική — φιλικότερα με σκυλιά από πολλά τεριέ. Έχουν ένστικτο θήρας. Προσαρμόζονται σε διαμέρισμα. Γενικά καλά με παιδιά. Η γενειάδα πρέπει να καθαρίζεται.
health_en: Welsh Terriers are generally a healthy, hardy breed with a typical lifespan of 12–15 years. Primary glaucoma is the most significant breed-specific eye condition — regular eye examinations and monitoring for signs of eye pain, redness, or cloudiness are important; gonioscopy testing by a veterinary ophthalmologist is recommended. Primary lens luxation (PLL) can also occur — a DNA test is available. Allergies, including atopic dermatitis and food allergies, are relatively common in the breed. Hypothyroidism can develop and is manageable with medication. Hip dysplasia can occur, though it is less common than in larger breeds. Epilepsy has been reported in some lines. Patellar luxation is an occasional concern. Skin conditions and hot spots can develop, particularly in warm weather. Dental disease should be monitored. The breed is generally considered one of the healthier terrier breeds with relatively few serious genetic conditions. Responsible breeders screen for glaucoma (gonioscopy), PLL, eyes, hips, and thyroid.
health_el: Τα Ουαλικά Τεριέ είναι γενικά υγιή ράτσα με τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 12–15 χρόνια. Το πρωτοπαθές γλαύκωμα είναι η σημαντικότερη οφθαλμική ανησυχία — τακτικές εξετάσεις και γωνιοσκόπηση συνιστώνται. Η PLL μπορεί να εμφανιστεί — υπάρχει τεστ DNA. Αλλεργίες είναι σχετικά κοινές. Ο υποθυρεοειδισμός μπορεί να αναπτυχθεί. Η δυσπλασία ισχίου μπορεί να εμφανιστεί. Η επιληψία έχει αναφερθεί. Θεωρείται μία από τις πιο υγιείς ράτσες τεριέ. Οι υπεύθυνοι εκτροφείς ελέγχουν γλαύκωμα, PLL, μάτια, ισχία και θυρεοειδή.

description_en: The West Highland White Terrier, affectionately known as the 'Westie,' is one of the most popular and recognizable terrier breeds in the world, with their bright white coat, compact body, dark eyes, and cheerful expression making them a beloved icon of the dog world. Originating in the Western Highlands of Scotland, the breed is believed to have been developed by Colonel Edward Donald Malcolm of Poltalloch in the late 19th century after he accidentally shot one of his reddish-brown Cairn Terriers during a hunt, mistaking it for a fox — he then resolved to breed only white terriers so they could never be confused with quarry again. Westies are small (7–10 kg, about 28 cm tall), sturdy, and surprisingly tough dogs with a harsh, dense double coat that was designed to protect them while working in the rough Scottish terrain. They are among the most outgoing and friendly of the Highland terrier breeds — cheerful, confident, and always ready for adventure. They have been widely used in advertising (most notably as the Cesar dog food mascot and the Black & White Scotch whisky logo alongside the Scottish Terrier), making them one of the most commercially recognizable breeds.
description_el: Το Γουέστ Χάιλαντ Γουάιτ Τεριέ, γνωστό ως «Westie», είναι μία από τις πιο δημοφιλείς ράτσες τεριέ, με το φωτεινό λευκό τρίχωμα να τα καθιστά εμβληματικά. Αναπτύχθηκε στα Δυτικά Υψίπεδα Σκωτίας αφού ο Colonel Malcolm σκότωσε κατά λάθος ένα κόκκινο Cairn Terrier κατά τη διάρκεια κυνηγιού — αποφάσισε να εκτρέφει μόνο λευκά τεριέ. Είναι μικρά (7–10 κιλά), γερά σκυλιά με σκληρό τρίχωμα. Ανάμεσα στα πιο εξωστρεφή τεριέ — ευχάριστα, σίγουρα, πάντα έτοιμα για περιπέτεια. Ευρέως χρησιμοποιούμενα στη διαφήμιση (Cesar, Black & White whisky).
care_en: West Highland White Terriers need regular daily exercise — about 30–45 minutes of walks and play — and they enjoy earthdog trials, agility, and interactive games. Their harsh, dense double coat requires weekly brushing to prevent matting and hand-stripping two to three times per year to maintain proper coat texture (clipping is acceptable for pets). Their white coat can show dirt easily, but frequent bathing should be avoided as it can dry out their skin; spot cleaning is preferable. Skin and coat health is particularly important in this breed — using gentle, hypoallergenic grooming products is recommended. Training should be positive, consistent, and engaging — Westies are intelligent but independent and can be stubborn; varied, reward-based sessions work best. Early socialization with people, dogs, and environments helps develop their naturally confident, friendly temperament. They have a prey drive and will chase small animals. They can be diggers and barkers — early training helps manage these behaviors. They adapt well to apartment living with adequate exercise. They are generally good with older children but may be too assertive for very young children.
care_el: Τα Westies χρειάζονται τακτική καθημερινή άσκηση — 30–45 λεπτά. Το σκληρό τρίχωμα απαιτεί εβδομαδιαίο βούρτσισμα και hand-stripping 2–3 φορές τον χρόνο. Η υγεία δέρματος είναι ιδιαίτερα σημαντική — υποαλλεργικά προϊόντα συνιστώνται. Η εκπαίδευση πρέπει να είναι θετική — ανεξάρτητα αλλά ανταποκρίνονται σε ανταμοιβές. Η πρώιμη κοινωνικοποίηση βοηθά. Μπορεί να σκάβουν και να γαβγίζουν. Προσαρμόζονται σε διαμέρισμα.
health_en: West Highland White Terriers have a typical lifespan of 13–15 years. Atopic dermatitis (skin allergies) is the most significant and common health concern — Westies are one of the most affected breeds and may require lifelong management through medication, immunotherapy, special diets, or a combination of approaches. Craniomandibular osteopathy (CMO or 'Westie jaw') — abnormal bone growth in the jaw and skull — can affect puppies between 3–8 months but usually resolves by 12 months. Legg-Calve-Perthes disease (degeneration of the femoral head) can occur in young dogs. Patellar luxation is a common orthopedic condition. Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis ('Westie lung disease') is a serious breed-specific condition causing progressive scarring of the lungs and breathing difficulty. Addison's disease (hypoadrenocorticism) occurs at higher rates. Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and food sensitivities are common. Cataracts and dry eye (KCS) are eye concerns. White shaker syndrome (idiopathic cerebellitis) can cause full-body tremors. Responsible breeders screen for patellae, eyes, and are aware of skin and respiratory conditions in their lines.
health_el: Τα Westies έχουν τυπική διάρκεια ζωής 13–15 χρόνια. Η ατοπική δερματίτιδα είναι η πιο σημαντική ανησυχία — μία από τις πιο επηρεαζόμενες ράτσες, απαιτώντας δια βίου διαχείριση. Η κρανιογναθική οστεοπάθεια μπορεί να επηρεάσει κουτάβια. Η νόσος Legg-Calve-Perthes μπορεί να εμφανιστεί. Η εξάρθρωση επιγονατίδας είναι κοινή. Η ιδιοπαθής πνευμονική ίνωση («νόσος πνεύμονα Westie») είναι σοβαρή πάθηση ειδική ράτσας. Η νόσος Addison εμφανίζεται σε υψηλότερα ποσοστά. Αλεξρεργίες τροφών είναι κοινές. Ο καταρράκτης και η ξηροφθαλμία είναι ανησυχίες. Οι υπεύθυνοι εκτροφείς ελέγχουν επιγονατίδα, μάτια και γνωρίζουν τα δερματικά και αναπνευστικά ζητήματα.
